page.title: 07LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: {The Chatri.}Erected during the 1st World War as a funeral Pire for the Indian soldiers. {Patcham Place.}Is an imposing building with mathematical tiles on the front.It was originally built in 1588 by Baron de la Warr,inspired by the design of Hampton Court.Later the house was sold to Richard Shelley,an ancestor of the poet.One of the famous people to live there was Anthony Stapley one of the signatories of the death warrant of Charles 1.It was opened as a Youth Hostel in 1939.The house is said to have a ghost who rings a bell when people have tea. {The Dovecote.}Or columbarium is 600 years.It is a stone building with a dormer window.Its walls are 3 ft thick;inside there was a mechanical device for reaching nesting boxes.Its use was to give food and sport.
